summary.long: Deuteronomy is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel on the other side of the Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel and Laban and Hazeroth and Dizahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It is an eleven-day journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh Barnea.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, Moses spoke to the children of Israel, according to all that the Lord had commanded him to give to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was after he had slain Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who lived at Ashtaroth in Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Across the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses began to declare this law, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God spoke to us in Horeb, saying, “You have dwelt long enough at this mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Turn, and take your journey, and go to the mountains of the Amorites, and to all their neighbors, in the plain, in the mountains and in the lowland, in the Negev and by the seacoast, to the land of the Canaanites and to Lebanon, as far as the great river, the River Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have set the land before you. Go in and possess the land which the Lord swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give to them and to their descendants after them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke to you at that time, saying, “I am not able to bear you by myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God has multiplied you, and surely you are this day as numerous as the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times more numerous and bless you, just as He has promised you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can I myself bear your load and your burden and your strife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Choose wise, discerning, and knowing men, among your tribes, and I will appoint them as leaders over you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You answered me, and said, “The thing which you have said is good for us to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the leaders of your tribes, wise and well-known men, and appointed them as leaders over you, leaders over thousands, and leaders over hundreds, and leaders over fifties, and leaders over tens, and officers among your tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charged your judges at that time, saying, “Hear the issues between your countrymen, and judge righteously between every man and his fellow countryman, and the foreigner that is with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not show partiality in judgment, but you shall hear the small as well as the great. You shall not be afraid in any man’s presence, for the judgment is God’s. The case that is too hard for you, you shall bring it to me, and I will hear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, I commanded you all the things you should do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we departed from Horeb, we went through all that great and terrible wilderness, which you saw by the way of the mountain of the Amorites, as the Lord our God commanded us, and we came to Kadesh Barnea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to you, “You have come to the mountains of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is giving to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the Lord your God has set the land before you. Go up and possess it, just as the Lord, the God of your fathers, spoke to you. Do not fear or be discouraged.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all of you came near to me and said, “Let us send men before us, so that they shall scout out the land, and bring back to us word concerning what way we should go up and into what cities we shall come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thing pleased me, and I took twelve men from you, one out of each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turned and went up into the hill country and came to the Valley of Eshkol and scouted it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought it down to us, and brought us word again, and said, “It is a good land which the Lord our God is giving us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you were not willing to go up, but rebelled against the commandment of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You murmured in your tents, and said, “Because the Lord hates us, He has brought us out of the land of Egypt to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites to destroy us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where shall we go up? Our brothers have discouraged our hearts, saying, ‘The people are greater and taller than we. The cities are great and walled up to heaven. And moreover, we have seen the sons of the Anakites there.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to you, “Do not be terrified, or afraid of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God who goes before you, He shall fight for you, just as all that He did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the wilderness, where you saw how the Lord your God carried you, as a man carries his son, in all the way that you went, until you came to this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet in this thing you did not believe the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who went in the way before you, to find you a place to pitch your tents, in fire by night and in a cloud by day, to show you by what way you should go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord heard the sound of your words, and was angry, and vowed, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Not one of these men of this evil generation will see the good land which I swore to give to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The exception will be Caleb the son of Jephunneh. He shall see it, and to him I will give the land upon which he has walked, and to his children, because he has wholly followed the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the Lord was angry with me on your account, saying, “You also shall not go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua the son of Nun, who stands before you, he shall go in. Encourage him, for he will cause Israel to inherit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, your little ones, who you said would be a prey, and your children, who in that day had no knowledge between good and evil, they shall go in, and to them will I give it, and they shall possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, turn around, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you answered and said to me, “We have sinned against the Lord. We will go up and fight, just as the Lord our God commanded us.” So each of you girded on his weapons of war and you thought it easy to go up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Tell them, ‘Do not go up nor fight, for I am not among you; lest you be defeated before your enemies.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I spoke to you, but you would not listen. Instead, you rebelled against the commandment of the Lord and went presumptuously up into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amorites, who lived in the hill country, came out against you, and chased you as bees do, and destroyed you in Seir as far as Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you returned and wept before the Lord, but the Lord would neither listen to your voice nor give ear to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you dwelt in Kadesh many days, according to the days you dwelt there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we turned, and set out toward the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea, as the Lord spoke to me, and we circled Mount Seir for many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have circled this mountain long enough. Now turn north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the people, saying: You are to pass through the territory of your brothers the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir, and they shall be afraid of you. So carefully watch yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not provoke them, for I will not give you any of their land, no, not so much as a footprint, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau for a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may buy food from them with money so that you may eat, and you may also buy water from them with money so that you may drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the Lord your God has blessed you in all the works of your hands. He knows your wanderings through this great wilderness. These forty years the Lord your God has been with you. You have lacked nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we passed by our brothers, the children of Esau, who lived in Seir, through the way of the plain from Elath and from Ezion Geber, and we turned and passed by the way of the Wilderness of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Do not harass the Moabites, nor contend with them in battle, for I will not give you any of their land for a possession, because I have given Ar to the children of Lot as a possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Emites lived there in times past, a people as great and as many and as tall as the Anakites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people, as well as the Anakites, also were regarded as giants, but the Moabites call them Emites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Horites also formerly lived in Seir, but the children of Esau dispossessed and destroyed them, and settled there in their place, just as Israel did to the land of its possession, which the Lord gave to them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cross over the Zered Valley.” So we went over the Zered Valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the length of time it took for us to come to Kadesh Barnea until we crossed over the brook Zered was thirty-eight years, until all the generation of the men of war perished from among the army, just as the Lord swore to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed the hand of the Lord was against them, to destroy them from among their midst, until they were gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came to pass, when all the men of war were gone and dead from among the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord spoke to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Today, you are to pass over through Ar, the border of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come close to the Ammonites, do not harass them or provoke them, for I will not give you any of the land of the Ammonites as a possession, because I have given it to the children of Lot for a possession.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (That also is considered the land of giants. Giants formerly lived there, but the Ammonites call them Zamzummites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were a great people, as numerous and tall as the Anakites. But the Lord destroyed them before the Ammonites. Then they dispossessed them and lived in their place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as He had done for the children of Esau, who lived in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites from before them, and they dispossessed them, and lived in their place even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Avvites, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorites, who came out of Caphtor, destroyed them, and lived in their place.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise, set out, and cross the River Arnon. See, I have given Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land into your hand. Begin to possess it and contend with him in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This day I will begin to put the dread of you and the fear of you on the nations that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear the report of you, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent messengers out of the Wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon, king of Heshbon, with words of peace, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let me pass through your land. I will only go on the main road. I will not turn aside to the right or the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall sell me food for money so that I may eat, and give me water for money so that I may drink, only allow me to pass through on foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the children of Esau who dwell in Seir and the Moabites who dwell in Ar did for me, until I pass over the Jordan into the land which the Lord our God is giving us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon, king of Heshbon, would not let us pass by him, for the Lord your God hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate, so that He might deliver him into your hand as he is to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “See, I have begun to give Sihon and his land to you. Begin to possess it, so that you may inherit his land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord our God delivered him over to us, and we struck him down with his sons and all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took all his cities at that time and utterly destroyed the men, the women, and the children of every city. We left no survivors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took only the livestock for plunder and the spoils of the cities which we took.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Aroer, which is on the bank of the River Arnon, and from the city that is in the valley, all the way to Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us. The Lord our God delivered all to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only you did not come near the land of the Ammonites, nor to any place on the River Jabbok, nor to the cities in the hill country, nor to any place the Lord our God had forbidden us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we turned and went up the way to Bashan, and Og, the king of Bashan, came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Do not fear him, for I will deliver him and all his people and his land into your hand; and you shall do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord, our God, delivered Og, the king of Bashan, with all his people, into our hands also, and we struck him down until there was no survivor remaining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took all his cities at that time. There was not a city which we did not take from them: sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these cities were fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, besides a great many rural towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We utterly destroyed them, as we did to Sihon, king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children of every city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we took all the livestock and the spoil of the cities as plunder for ourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So at that time we took from the hand of the two kings of the Amorites the land that was across the Jordan, from the River Arnon to Mount Hermon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (the Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, as far as Salekah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For only Og, king of Bashan, remained of the remnant of the giants. (Notably, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron. Is it not in Rabbah of the children of Ammon? It is nine cubits long and four cubits wide, according to the cubit of a man.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the land which we possessed at that time from Aroer, which is by the River Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead and its cities I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh. (All the region of Argob, with all Bashan, was called the land of giants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair, the son of Manasseh, took all the region of Argob, that is, Bashan, as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maakathites, and called the villages after his own name, Havvoth Jair, as it is to this day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave Gilead to Makir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the Reubenites and to the Gadites I gave the territory from Gilead even as far as the stream bed of the River Arnon, half the valley as the border to the River Jabbok, which is the border of the Ammonites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the plain also, with the Jordan as the border, from Kinnereth as far as the east side of the Sea of the Arabah (that is, the Dead Sea), below the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I commanded you at that time, saying, “The Lord your God has given you this land to possess it. All you men of valor shall pass over armed before your brothers, the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your wives and your little ones, and your livestock (for I know that you have much livestock) shall remain in your cities which I have given you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the Lord has given rest to your brothers, as well as to you, and until they also possess the land which the Lord your God has given them beyond the Jordan. Then each of you shall return to his possession which I have given you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, “Your eyes have seen all that the Lord your God has done to these two kings. So shall the Lord do to all the kingdoms where you pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not fear them, for the Lord your God, He shall fight for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pleaded with the Lord at that time, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Lord God, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness, and Your mighty hand, for what god is there in heaven or in earth that can do according to Your works and according to Your might?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me, I pray, go over and see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that good hill country, and Lebanon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord was angry with me because of you and would not listen to me, and the Lord said to me, “Enough of that! Speak to Me no more of this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get up to the top of Pisgah and lift up your eyes to the west and north and south and east, and see it with your eyes, for you shall not cross over this Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But charge Joshua and encourage him and strengthen him, for he shall cross over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which you will see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we remained in the valley over against Beth Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, listen, O Israel, to the statutes and to the judgments which I am teaching you to do, so that you may live; and go in and possess the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not add to the word which I am commanding you, nor shall you take anything from it, so that you may keep the commandments of the Lord your God which I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eyes have seen what the Lord did at Baal Peor; for the Lord your God has destroyed from among you all the men who followed Baal of Peor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you who held fast to the Lord your God are alive to this day, every one of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I have taught you statutes and judgments, just as the Lord my God commanded me, that you should do so in the land where you are entering to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, keep and do them, for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations which shall hear all these statutes, and say, “Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what nation is there so great, who has a god so near to it as the Lord our God is in all things whenever we call on Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what nation is there so great that has statutes and judgments so righteous as all this law, which I am setting before you today?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only give heed to yourself and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things which your eyes have seen and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life; but teach them to your sons, and your grandsons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Especially concerning the day you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, when the Lord said to me, “Gather the people together to Me, so that I will let them hear My words so that they may learn to fear Me all the days they shall live on the earth, and so that they may teach their children.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you came near and stood at the foot of the mountain, and the mountain burned with fire up to the midst of heaven, with darkness, a cloud, a thick cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to you out of the midst of the fire. You heard the sound of the words but saw no form—only a voice was heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He declared to you His covenant, which He commanded you to perform, even the Ten Commandments, and He wrote them on two tablets of stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, so that you might do them in the land which you are crossing over to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give good care to yourselves, for you saw no form on the day that the Lord spoke to you in Horeb from the midst of the fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest you corrupt yourselves and make a graven image for yourselves in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flies in the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And beware, lest you lift up your eyes to heaven, and when you see the sun, and the moon, and the stars, even all the host of heaven, you are led astray and worship them, and serve them, that which the Lord your God has allotted to all nations under the whole heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord has taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, from Egypt, to be to Him a people of inheritance, as you are today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the Lord was angry with me because of you and swore that I should not cross over the Jordan, and that I would not go into that good land which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I must die in this land. I shall not cross over the Jordan, but you shall go over and possess that good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch yourselves, so that you do not forget the covenant of the Lord your God, which He made with you, and make yourself a graven image or the likeness of anything as the Lord your God has forbidden you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire. He is a jealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you produce children and grandchildren and you have remained a long time in the land, and you corrupt yourselves and make a graven image, or the likeness of anything, and do evil in the sight of the Lord your God, to provoke Him to anger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that you will surely and suddenly perish from off the land that you are going across the Jordan to possess. You will not prolong your days on it, but shall be completely destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord shall scatter you among the peoples, and you shall be left few in number among the nations where the Lord shall lead you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you will serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see nor hear nor eat nor smell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if from there you will seek the Lord your God, you will find Him, if you seek Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you are in distress and all these things come upon you, even in the latter days, if you turn to the Lord your God and shall be obedient to His voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the Lord your God is a merciful God), He will not abandon you or destroy you or forget the covenant of your fathers which He swore to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, ask about the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and ask from one end of heavens to the other, whether there has ever been any such thing as this great thing, or has anything like it ever been heard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has a people ever heard the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or has God ever tried to take for Himself a nation from the midst of another nation, by trials, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched-out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To you it was shown so that you might know that the Lord, He is God. There is no one else besides Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of heaven He let you hear His voice so that He might instruct you, and on earth He showed you His great fire, and you heard His words out of the midst of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because He loved your fathers, therefore He chose their descendants after them and personally brought you out of Egypt with His mighty power
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to drive out nations from before you greater and mightier than you are, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know therefore today, and consider it in your heart, that the Lord, He is God in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you shall keep His statutes and His commandments which I command you this day, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you, and so that you may prolong your days in the land, which the Lord your God gives you, forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses set apart three cities across the Jordan, toward the east,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the manslayer might flee there, that is, anyone who killed his neighbor unintentionally without hating him in time past could flee to one of these cities and live:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer in the wilderness in the plateau of the Reubenites, and Ramoth in Gilead of the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan of the Manassites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances which Moses spoke to the children of Israel, after they came out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on this side of the Jordan, in the valley over against Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel struck down, after they had come out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They possessed his land, and the land of Og, king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were across the Jordan toward the east,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Aroer, which is by the edge of the River Arnon, even as far as Mount Sion (that is, Hermon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all the Arabah across the Jordan to the east, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called all Israel and said to them: Hear, O Israel, the statutes and ordinances which I am speaking in your hearing today, so that you may learn them, and keep, and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, we who are living now and here today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord talked with you face to face on the mountain from the midst of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I stood between the Lord and you at that time to declare to you the word of the Lord; for you were afraid because of the fire and would not go up to the mountain. He said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord, your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have no other gods before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make yourself any graven image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the waters beneath the earth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not bow down to them, nor serve them. For I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing mercy to thousands of them that love Me and keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not exonerate anyone who takes His name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, just as the Lord your God has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work: you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your livestock, nor the foreigner that is within your gates, so that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and that the Lord your God brought you out from there with a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm; therefore your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor your father and your mother, just as the Lord your God has commanded you, that your days may be prolonged, and that it may go well with you in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor shall you covet your neighbor’s house, his field, his male servant, his female servant, his ox, his donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words the Lord spoke to all your assembly at the mountain out from the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the thick darkness with a great voice, and He added no more. He wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain did burn with fire, you came near to me, all the heads of your tribes, and your elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said, “See, the Lord our God has shown us His glory and His greatness, and we have heard His voice from the midst of the fire. We have seen this day that God speaks with man, yet he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear the voice of the Lord our God any more, then we will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For who is there of all flesh who has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go near and hear all that the Lord our God will say. Then speak to us all that the Lord our God will speak to you, and we will hear and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord heard the sound of your words when you spoke to me, and the Lord said to me, “I have heard the sound of the words of this people which they have spoken to you. They have done well in all that they have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O that there were such a heart in them that they would fear Me and always keep all My commandments, that it might be well with them and with their children forever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go say to them, ‘Return to your tents.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, stand here by Me, so that I may speak to you all the commandments, and the statutes, and the ordinances which you shall teach them, that they may keep them in the land which I am giving them to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, be careful to do as the Lord your God has commanded you. You shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall walk in all the ways which the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances which the Lord your God commanded to teach you, so that you may observe them in the land which you are crossing over to possess,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you might fear the Lord your God in order to keep all His statutes and His commandments which I command you—you, and your son, and your grandson—all the days of your life, so that your days may be prolonged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear therefore, O Israel, and be careful to do it, so that it may be well with you and so that you may multiply greatly, as the Lord the God of your fathers has promised you in the land that flows with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, O Israel: The Lord is our God. The Lord is one!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words, which I am commanding you today, shall be in your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall teach them diligently to your children and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it shall be when the Lord your God brings you into the land which He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give you great and fine cities, which you did not build,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and houses full of all good things which you did not fill, and hewn cisterns which you did not dig, vineyards and olive trees which you did not plant, and you eat and are full,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then beware lest you forget the Lord who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall fear the Lord your God and serve Him and shall swear by His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not go after other gods, the gods of the people which surround you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the Lord your God is a jealous God among you). Otherwise the anger of the Lord your God will be inflamed against you and destroy you from off the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not tempt the Lord your God, as you tempted Him in Massah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall diligently keep the commandments of the Lord your God, and His testimonies and His statutes which He has commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do what is right and good in the sight of the Lord that it may be well with you and that you may go in and possess the good land which the Lord swore to your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to drive out all your enemies before you, just as the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your son asks you in time to come, saying, “What do the testimonies and the statutes and the judgments mean which the Lord our God has commanded you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say to your son, “We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, and the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord showed great and devastating signs and wonders upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his household before our eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought us out from there, so that He might bring us in, to give us the land which He swore to our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear the Lord our God, for our good always, that He might preserve us, as He has to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be our righteousness if we are careful to keep all these commandments before the Lord our God, just as He has commanded us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God brings you into the land which you are entering to possess and has driven out many nations before you, the Hittites and the Girgashites and the Amorites and the Canaanites and the Perizzites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and mightier than you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when the Lord your God delivers them before you and you strike them down, then you must utterly destroy them. You shall make no covenant with them nor show mercy to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is more, you shall not intermarry with them. You shall not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they will turn your sons away from following Me to serve other gods. Then the anger of the Lord will be inflamed against you, and He will quickly destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is how you shall deal with them: You shall destroy their altars and break down their images and cut down their Asherim and burn their graven images with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God. The Lord your God has chosen you to be His special people, treasured above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord did not set His love on you nor choose you because you were more in number than any of the peoples, for you were the fewest of all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is because the Lord loved you and because He kept the oath which He swore to your fathers. The Lord brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you out of the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh, king of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know therefore that the Lord your God, He is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and mercy with them who love Him and keep His commandments to a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet He repays those who hate Him to their face, to destroy them. He will not be slack with him who hates Him. He will repay him to his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore keep the commandments and the statutes and the judgments which I command you today, by doing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you listen to these judgments, keep them, and do them, then the Lord your God shall keep with you the covenant and the mercy which He swore to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will love you and bless you and multiply you. He will also bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your land, your grain, and your wine, and your oil, the increase of your herd and the young of your flock, in the land which He swore to your fathers to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be blessed above all peoples. There will not be male or female barren among you or among your livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will take away from you all sickness, and will afflict you with none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you know, but will lay them on all those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must consume all the peoples whom the Lord your God will deliver to you. Your eye shall have no pity on them, nor shall you serve their gods, for that will be a snare to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you say in your heart, “These nations are greater than I—how can I dispossess them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not be afraid of them. You must surely remember what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great trials which your eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the stretched-out arm, by which the Lord your God brought you out. So the Lord your God will do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover the Lord your God will send the hornet among them, until they who are left and hide themselves from you perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not be frightened of them, for the Lord your God is among you, a great and awesome God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will drive out those nations before you, little by little. You will not be able to destroy them all at once, lest the beasts of the field become too numerous for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord your God will deliver them to you and will throw them into a great confusion until they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will deliver their kings into your hand so that you may erase their names from under heaven. No man will be able to stand before you until you have destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must burn the graven images of their gods with fire. You must not desire the silver or gold that is on them nor take any of it, lest you be snared by them, for it is an abomination to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not bring an abomination into your house, lest you become cursed like it, but you must absolutely detest and abhor it, for it is a cursed thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must carefully keep all the commandments that I am commanding you today, so that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which the Lord swore to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must remember that the Lord your God led you all the way these forty years in the wilderness, to humble you, and to prove you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep His commandments or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He humbled you and let you suffer hunger, and fed you with manna, which you did not know, nor did your fathers know, that He might make you know that man does not live by bread alone; but man lives by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your clothing did not wear out on you, nor did your feet swell these forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also consider in your heart that, as a man disciplines his son, so the Lord your God disciplines you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you must keep the commandments of the Lord your God, to walk in His ways and to fear Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is bringing you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and springs that flow out of valleys and hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land of wheat, barley, vines, fig trees, and pomegranates, a land of olive oil and honey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land where you may eat bread without scarcity, in which you will not lack anything, a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have eaten and are full, then you shall bless the Lord your God for the good land which He has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware that you do not forget the Lord your God by not keeping His commandments, and His judgments, and His statutes, which I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, when you have eaten and are full and have built and occupied good houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when your herds and your flocks multiply, and your silver and your gold multiply, and all that you have multiplies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then your heart will become proud and you will forget the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who led you through that great and terrible wilderness, where there were fiery serpents and scorpions and drought, where there was no water, who brought forth for you water out of the rock of flint,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers did not know, that He might humble you and that He might prove you, to do good for you in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, you may say in your heart, “My power and the might of my hand have gained me this wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must remember the Lord your God, for it is He who gives you the ability to get wealth, so that He may establish His covenant which He swore to your fathers, as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ever forget the Lord your God and go after other gods and serve them and worship them, then I testify against you today that you will surely perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just like the nations which the Lord will destroy before you, so shall you perish because you would not be obedient to the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear, O Israel! You are to cross over the Jordan today, to go in to possess nations greater and mightier than you, great cities fortified up to heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a great and tall people, the children of the Anakites, whom you know and of whom you have heard it said, “Who can stand before the children of Anak?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understand therefore today that the Lord your God is He who goes over before you as a consuming fire. He shall destroy them and shall bring them down before you, so that you drive them out and destroy them quickly, as the Lord has spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not say in your heart, after the Lord your God has driven them out before you, “On account of my righteousness the Lord has brought me in to possess this land,” but it is because of the wickedness of these nations the Lord is driving them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not because of your righteousness or the uprightness of your heart that you enter to possess their land, but because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord your God drives them out before you, and that He may fulfill the word which the Lord swore to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Understand, therefore, that the Lord your God is not giving you this good land to possess on account of your righteousness, for you are a stubborn people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, and do not forget how you provoked the Lord your God to wrath in the wilderness. From the day that you departed out of the land of Egypt until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also in Horeb you provoked the Lord to wrath, so that the Lord was angry enough with you to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went up into the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant which the Lord made with you, then I remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I did not eat bread or drink water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord delivered to me two tablets of stone, written with the finger of God, and on them was written all the words which the Lord spoke to you at the mountain out of the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of forty days and forty nights, the Lord gave me the two tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Arise, go down from here quickly, for your people whom you brought out of Egypt have corrupted themselves. They are quickly turned aside from the way which I commanded them. They have made a molded image for themselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore the Lord spoke to me, saying, “I have seen this people, and indeed, they are a stubborn people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Me alone, so that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven, and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I returned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire, and the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked, and indeed, you had sinned against the Lord your God and had made yourselves a molded calf. You had quickly turned aside out of the way which the Lord had commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took the two tablets and threw them out of my two hands and broke them before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fell down before the Lord, as at the first, forty days and forty nights. I did not eat bread or drink water because of all your sins which you committed, doing what was wicked in the sight of the Lord to provoke Him to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure with which the Lord was wrathful against you to destroy you. But the Lord listened to me at that time also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, so I also prayed for Aaron at the same time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burned it with fire, and crushed it, and ground it very small until it was as small as dust. Then I threw the dust into the brook that descended down from the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also at Taberah and at Massah and at Kibroth Hattaavah you provoked the Lord to wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise when the Lord sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, “Go up and possess the land which I have given you,” then you rebelled against the commandment of the Lord your God, and you did not believe Him or listen to His voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have been rebellious against the Lord from the day I knew you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I fell down before the Lord forty days and forty nights; I fell down because the Lord had said He would destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I prayed therefore to the Lord, and said, “O Lord God, do not destroy Your people, Your inheritance, which You have redeemed through Your greatness, which You have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Do not look at the stubbornness of this people or at their wickedness or their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, the land from which You brought us may say, ‘Because the Lord was not able to bring them into the land which He promised them and because He hated them, He has brought them out to slay them in the wilderness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they are Your people, Your inheritance, whom You brought out by Your mighty power and by Your stretched-out arm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord said to me, “Cut out for yourself two tablets of stone like the first and come up to Me onto the mountain and make an ark of wood for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets which you broke, and you shall put them in the ark.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I made an ark of acacia wood and cut out two tablets of stone just like the first and went up onto the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wrote on the tablets just like the first writing, the Ten Commandments which the Lord spoke to you at the mountain out of the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly, and the Lord gave them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I turned around and came down from the mountain and put the tablets in the ark which I had made, and there they are, just as the Lord commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The children of Israel set out from Beeroth of the sons of Jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died and was buried, and his son Eleazar ministered in the priest’s office in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of rivers of waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Lord set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to stand before the Lord to minister to Him, and to bless in His name, to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, Levi has no portion or inheritance with his brothers. The Lord is his inheritance, just as the Lord your God promised him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, I stayed on the mountain like the first time, forty days and forty nights, and the Lord listened to me at that time also. The Lord was not willing to destroy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Arise, take your journey before the people, so that they may go in and possess the land which I swore to give to their fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you, but to fear the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, and to love Him, and to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to keep the commandments of the Lord and His statutes which I am commanding you today for your good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, heaven and the highest heavens belong to the Lord your God, also the earth with all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord delighted only in your fathers, to love them; and He chose their descendants after them, even you above all people, as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, circumcise your heart, and do not be stubborn anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is the God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, the mighty, and the fearsome God who is unbiased and takes no bribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He executes the judgment of the orphan and the widow and loves the foreigner, giving him food and clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, love the foreigner, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must fear the Lord your God. You must serve Him and cling to Him, and swear by His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is your praise, and He is your God, who has done for you these great and fearsome things which your eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers went down into Egypt with seventy people, and now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must love the Lord your God and keep His charge, His statutes, His ordinances, and His commandments always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know this day that I am not speaking with your children who have not known and who have not seen the discipline of the Lord your God, His greatness, His mighty hand, and His outstretched arm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and His signs and His works which He did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and to all his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what He did to the army of Egypt, to their horses, and to their chariots, when He made the water of the Red Sea to flow over them as they pursued after you, and how the Lord utterly destroyed them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what He did to you in the wilderness until you came to this place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and what He did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben, when the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, their households, their tents, and everything that was in their possession, in the midst of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your eyes have seen all the great deeds of the Lord which He did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you must keep all the commandments which I am commanding you today, so that you may be strong and go in and possess the land which you are going to possess;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that you may prolong your days in the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give to them and to their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the land which you are entering to possess is not like the land of Egypt from where you came, where you sowed your seed and watered it with your foot like a vegetable garden,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the land, which you are entering to possess, is a land of hills and valleys and drinks water from the rain of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a land for which the Lord your God cares. The eyes of the Lord your God are always on it, from the beginning of the year even to the end of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be, if you will diligently obey My commandments which I am commanding you today, to love the Lord your God, and to serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will give you the rain of your land in its season, the early rain and the latter rain, that you may gather in your grain and your wine and your oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will provide grass in your fields for your livestock, that you may eat and be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed to yourselves that your heart be not deceived, and you turn away and serve other gods and worship them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord’s wrath will be inflamed against you, and He will shut up the heavens so that there will be no rain and the land will not yield its fruit, and you will quickly perish from the good land which the Lord is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you must fix these words of mine in your heart and in your soul, and bind them as a sign on your hand, so that they may be as frontlets between your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall teach them to your children, speaking of them when you sit in your house and when you walk by the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your days and the days of your children may be multiplied in the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give them, as long as the days of heaven on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you diligently keep all these commandments which I am commanding you to do—to love the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways, and to hold fast to Him—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will drive out all these nations from before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and mightier than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every place where the soles of your feet tread will be yours. Your border will be from the wilderness to Lebanon, from the river, the River Euphrates, as far as the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man will be able to resist you, for the Lord your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you on all the land where you shall tread, just as He has spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the blessing if you obey the commandments of the Lord your God, which I am commanding you today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the curse, if you will not obey the commandments of the Lord your God, but turn from the way which I am commanding you today, to go after other gods which you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it shall be, when the Lord your God has brought you into the land which you are entering to possess, that you shall put the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they not on the other side of the Jordan, west where the sun goes down, in the land of the Canaanites, who dwell in the plain opposite Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you will cross over the Jordan to go in to possess the land which the Lord your God is giving you, and you will possess it, and dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be careful to do all the statutes and judgments which I am setting before you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes and judgments which you shall be careful to observe in the land, which the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess, all the days that you live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must utterly destroy all the places where the nations which you will possess served their gods, on the high mountains, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall overthrow their altars, and break their pillars, and burn their Asherah poles with fire, and you shall cut down the engraved images of their gods, and eliminate their names out of that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not act this way toward the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must seek only the place which the Lord your God shall choose out of all your tribes to establish His name, and there you must go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you shall bring your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the offerings of your hand, your vows, your freewill offerings, and the firstborn of your herds and of your flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you must eat before the Lord your God, and you shall rejoice in all that you put your hand to, you and your households, where the Lord your God has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to do all the things that we are doing here today, where every man does whatever is right in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have not yet come to the rest and to the inheritance which the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you cross the Jordan, and dwell in the land which the Lord your God has given you to inherit, and when He gives you rest from all your enemies round about, so that you dwell in safety,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then there will be a place which the Lord your God will choose to cause His name to dwell. There you must bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, your tithes, the offering of your hand, and all your choice vows which you vow to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will rejoice before the Lord your God, you, your sons, your daughters, your male servants, your female servants, and the Levite who is within your gates, for he has no portion or inheritance with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful that you do not offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, in the place which the Lord will choose in one of your tribes, there you must offer your burnt offerings, and there you must do all that I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, you may kill and eat meat within all your gates, whatever your heart desires, according to the blessing of the Lord your God which He has given you. The unclean and the clean may eat of it, of the gazelle and of the deer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: only you must not eat the blood. You shall pour it on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, your wine, your oil, the firstborn of your herds or of your flock, any of your vows which you vow, your freewill offerings, or the offering of your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather you must eat them before the Lord your God in the place which the Lord your God will choose—you, your son, your daughter, your male servant, your female servant, and the Levite that is within your gates—and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God in all that you undertake to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take heed to yourself that you do not forsake the Levite as long as you live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God shall enlarge your border as He has promised you, and you say, “I will eat meat,” because you desire to eat meat, then you may eat as much meat as your heart desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the place which the Lord your God has chosen to put His name is too far from you, then you shall kill of your herd and of your flock, which the Lord has given you, as I have commanded you, and you must eat in your gates whatever your heart desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even as the gazelle and the deer are eaten, so you shall eat them. The unclean and the clean shall eat of them alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only be sure that you do not eat the blood. For the blood is the life, and you may not eat the life with the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat it. You must pour it on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat it, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you, when you do that which is right in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take only your holy things which you have, along with your vows, and go to the place which the Lord shall choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must offer your burnt offerings, the meat and the blood, on the altar of the Lord your God, and the blood of your sacrifices will be poured out on the altar of the Lord your God, and you shall eat the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe and hear all these words which I command you, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you forever, when you do that which is good and right in the sight of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God shall cut off the nations from before you, where you go to possess them, and you dispossess them, and dwell in their land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: take heed to yourself so that you are not ensnared by following them, after they have been destroyed before you, and that you not inquire after their gods, saying, “How did these nations serve their gods? Even so I will do likewise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not do so to the Lord your God, for every abomination to the Lord, which He hates, they have done to their gods. They have even burned their sons and their daughters in the fire to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever I command you, be careful to do it. You shall not add to it or take away from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you and gives you a sign or a wonder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass concerning that which he spoke to you, saying, “Let us go after other gods,” which you have not known, “and let us serve them,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must not listen to the words of that prophet or that dreamer of dreams, for the Lord your God is testing you, to know whether you love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must follow after the Lord your God, fear Him, and keep His commandments, obey His voice, and you must serve Him, and cling to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That prophet or that dreamer of dreams must be put to death because he has spoken in order to turn you away from the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to entice you away from the way in which the Lord your God commanded you to walk. So you must put the evil away from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or your beloved wife, or your friend, who is as your own soul, entices you secretly, saying, “Let us go and serve other gods,” which you have not known, neither you nor your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: namely, of the gods of the people who are all around you, near you or far away from you, from one end of the earth to the other end of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall not consent to him or listen to him, neither should your eye pity him, nor shall you spare or conceal him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you must surely kill him. Your hand must be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards, the hand of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall stone him with stones so that he dies because he has sought to entice you away from the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel shall hear and fear and no more do any such wickedness as this among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you hear it said in one of your cities, in which the Lord your God has given you to dwell, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Certain men, the sons of wickedness, are gone out from among you and have seduced the inhabitants of their city, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods,’ ” which you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall inquire, search out, and ask diligently. If it be true and certain that such an abomination has been among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall surely put the inhabitants of that city to the sword, utterly destroying it, all that is in it and its livestock—with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must gather all the spoils of it into the middle of the street and burn the city with fire along with all the spoils within it for the Lord your God, and it will be a heap forever. It must not be rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing of the cursed thing there must cling to your hand, so that the Lord may turn from the fierceness of His anger and show you mercy, have compassion on you, and multiply you, just as He swore to your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you listen to the voice of the Lord your God, to keep all His commandments which I command you today, and do that which is right in the eyes of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the sons of the Lord your God. You shall not cut yourselves or make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God, and the Lord has chosen you to be a peculiar people to Himself, treasured above all the nations that are on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat any detestable thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the deer, the gazelle, the fallow deer, the wild goat, and the ibex, and the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat every animal with divided hooves, with the hoof divided into two parts, and that chews the cud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, you may not eat of these that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof: the camel, the rabbit, and the coney. For they chew the cud, but their hoof is not divided, therefore they are unclean to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pig is unclean to you because it divides the hoof, yet it does not chew the cud. You must not eat of their flesh or touch their dead carcass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These you shall eat of all that are in the water: All that have fins and scales you may eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever does not have fins and scales you may not eat. It is unclean to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat of all clean birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, these are the ones which you cannot eat: the eagle, the vulture, the buzzard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the red kite, the falcon, and the kite after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every raven after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the ostrich, the owl, the seagull, and the hawk after its kind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the little owl, and the great owl, and the white owl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pelican, the carrion vulture, and the cormorant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stork, and the heron after its kind, and the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every creeping thing that flies is unclean to you. They must not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat all the clean birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You must not eat of anything that dies of itself, but you may give it to the foreigner that is in your gates, so that he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner, for you are a holy people to the Lord your God.
You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be certain to tithe all the produce of your seed, so that the field produces year by year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must eat before the Lord your God, in the place in which He shall choose to place His name, the tithe of your grain, of your wine, of your oil, and of the firstborn of your herds and of your flocks so that you may learn to always fear the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the distance is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry it, because the place is too far from you, where the Lord your God shall choose to set His name, when the Lord your God blesses you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall exchange it for money and bind up the money in your hand and go to the place which the Lord your God shall choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you may spend that money for whatever your heart desires, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever your heart desires, and you may eat there before the Lord your God, and you shall rejoice, you, and your household,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Levite that is within your gates. You must not forsake him, for he has no portion or inheritance with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of three years you must bring forth all the tithe of your produce the same year and lay it up within your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levite (because he has no portion or inheritance with you), the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates, shall come and shall eat and be satisfied, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of every seven years you shall grant a relinquishing of debts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the manner of the relinquishing: Every creditor that has loaned anything to his neighbor shall relinquish it. He shall not exact it of his neighbor, or of his brother, because it is called the Lord’s relinquishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may collect it from a foreigner, but that which your brother has that is yours your hand shall release.
verses.speaker: Narrator
