verses.text: However, there will be no poor among you, for the Lord will greatly bless you in the land which the Lord your God has given you for an inheritance to possess,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if only you carefully obey the voice of the Lord your God, by carefully observing all these commandments which I command you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God will bless you, just as He promised you, and you will lend to many nations, but you shall not borrow. You will reign over many nations, but they will not reign over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there be among you a poor man, one of your brothers within any of your gates in your land which the Lord your God has given you, you must not harden your heart or shut your hand from your poor brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall open your hand wide to him and must surely lend him what is sufficient for his need, in that which he lacks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest there be a wicked thought in your heart, saying, “The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand,” and your eye be evil against your poor brother and you give him nothing, and he cry out to the Lord against you, and it become sin in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must surely give to him, and your heart shall not be grieved when you give to him, because in this thing the Lord your God will bless you in all your works, and in all that you put your hand to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the poor will never cease from being in the land. Therefore, I command you, saying, “You shall open your hand wide to your brother, to your poor and needy in your land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you must let him go free from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you send him out free from you, you must not let him go away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall supply him liberally out of your flock, out of your floor, and out of your winepress. From that with which the Lord your God has blessed you, you shall give to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you. Therefore, I command this to you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, if he says to you, “I will not go away from you,” because he loves you and your house, because he is well off with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must take an awl and pierce it through his ear into the door, and he shall be your servant forever. And you shall also do likewise to your female servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will not seem difficult for you when you send him away free from you, for he has been worth a double hired servant in serving you six years. Then the Lord your God will bless you in all that you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must sanctify all the firstborn males that come out of your herd and flock to the Lord your God. You must do no work with the firstborn of your bulls or shear the firstborn of your sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat it before the Lord your God year by year in the place where the Lord shall choose, you and your household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is any defect in it, if it is lame or blind or has a serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat it within your gates. The unclean and the clean person alike shall eat it, as if it were a gazelle or a deer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only you must not eat its blood. You shall pour it on the ground like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Observe the month of Aviv and keep the Passover to the Lord your God, for in the month of Aviv the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you must sacrifice the Passover to the Lord your God, from the flock or the herd, in the place where the Lord shall choose to place His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not eat leavened bread with it. For seven days you must eat unleavened bread, the bread of affliction, for you came out of the land of Egypt in a hurry, so that you may remember all the days of your life the day when you came out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must not be any leavened bread seen with you within all your borders for seven days, nor may any of the meat which you sacrificed in the evening on the first day remain overnight until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not sacrifice the Passover within any of your gates that the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at the place where the Lord your God chooses to place His name, there you shall sacrifice the Passover in the evening at sunset, at the time that you came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall roast and eat it in the place where the Lord your God will choose, and you must return in the morning, and go to your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days you must eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly to the Lord your God. You must do no work on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must count seven weeks for yourself. Begin counting the seven weeks from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must keep the Feast of Weeks to the Lord your God with a tribute of a freewill offering from your hand, which you must give to the Lord your God, in proportion to how much the Lord your God has blessed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall rejoice before the Lord your God—you, your son, your daughter, your male servant, your female servant, the Levite who is within your gates, the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow who are among you—in the place where the Lord your God has chosen to place His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and you must be careful to observe these statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall observe the Feast of Tabernacles seven days after you have gathered in your threshing floor and your winepress,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall rejoice in your feast, you, your son, your daughter, your male servant, your female servant, the Levite, the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow who are within your gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to celebrate the festival for seven days to the Lord your God in the place where the Lord will choose, because the Lord your God will bless you in all your produce, and in all the works of your hands. Therefore, you will indeed rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your males must appear before the Lord your God in the place where He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, at the Feast of Weeks, and at the Feast of Tabernacles, and they must not appear before the Lord empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every man must give as he is able, in proportion to the blessing of the Lord your God, which He has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must appoint judges and officers in all your gates, which the Lord your God gives you, throughout your tribes, and they shall judge the people with righteous judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not pervert judgment nor show partiality. You must not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and perverts the words of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must follow that which is altogether just, so that you may live and inherit the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not plant for yourself an Asherah of any trees near the altar of the Lord your God, which you make for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not set up for yourself any image, which the Lord your God hates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not sacrifice to the Lord your God any bull or sheep that has a blemish or any defect, for that is detestable to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there be found among you, within any of your gates which the Lord your God gives you, man or woman, who has acted wickedly in the sight of the Lord your God, by transgressing His covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has gone and served other gods and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it is told to you, and you have heard of it, and investigated diligently, and it is true, and the matter is certain that such a detestable thing has happened in Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must bring forth that man or that woman who has committed that wicked thing to your gates, that very man or woman, and stone them with stones until they die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the testimony of two or three witnesses he that is to die must be put to death, but on the testimony of one witness he cannot be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hands of the witnesses shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So you shall purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there arises a matter too difficult for you in judgment, between one kind of bloodshed and another, between one kind of lawsuit and another, and between one kind of assault and another, matters of controversy within your gates, then you must arise and go up to the place where the Lord your God shall choose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must go to the Levitical priests or to the judge in office those days, and inquire, and they will show you the verdict of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do according to the verdict which they declare to you from the place where the Lord will choose to show you, and you must be careful to do all that they instruct you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must do according to the terms of the law which they instruct you and according to the verdict which they tell you. You must not deviate from the sentence which they show you, to the right or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who acts presumptuously and does not listen to the priest who stands to minister before the Lord your God, or to the judge—that man must die, and you must purge the evil from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people will hear, and fear, and not act presumptuously again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have come into the land which the Lord your God gives you and possess it and dwell there and then say, “I will set a king over me just like all the nations that are around me,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must set a king over you whom the Lord your God will choose. You must select a king over you who is from among your brothers. You may not select a foreigner over you who is not your countryman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is more, he shall not accumulate horses for himself or cause the people to return to Egypt in order that he accumulate horses, for as the Lord has said to you, “You must not go back that way ever again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not acquire many wives for himself, lest his heart turn away; nor shall he acquire for himself excess silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write a copy of this law for himself on a scroll before the priests, the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be with him, and he must read it all the days of his life so that he may learn to fear the Lord his God, and carefully observe all the words of this law and these statutes, and do them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that his heart will not be lifted up above his brothers and so that he may not turn aside from the commandment, to the right or to the left, to the end, so that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children, in the midst of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levitical priests and all the tribe of Levi will not have any portion or inheritance with Israel. They must eat the offerings of the Lord made by fire and His portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will have no inheritance among their brothers. The Lord is their inheritance, just as He has said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be the priest’s due from the people, from them that offer a sacrifice, whether it be an ox or sheep: they shall give to the priest the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must give him the first fruit of your grain, of your wine, and of your oil, and the first of the fleece of your sheep also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand to minister in the name of the Lord, him and his sons forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a Levite comes from any of your gates out of all Israel, where he lives, and comes with all the desire of his mind to the place where the Lord shall choose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he shall minister in the name of the Lord his God, as all his brothers the Levites do, who stand there before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must have the same portions to eat, besides any profits he may receive from the sale of his father’s inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you enter into the land which the Lord your God gives you, you must not learn to practice the abominations of those nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must not be found among you anyone who makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire, or who uses divination, or uses witchcraft, or an interpreter of omens, or a sorcerer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or one who casts spells, or a spiritualist, or an occultist, or a necromancer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all that do these things are an abomination to the Lord, and because of these abominations the Lord your God will drive them out from before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must be blameless before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these nations, which you shall possess, listened to soothsayers and to diviners, but as for you, the Lord your God has not permitted you to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet from the midst of you, of your brothers, like me. You must listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is according to all that you desired of the Lord your God in Horeb on the day of the assembly, saying, “Let me not hear again the voice of the Lord my God, nor let me see this great fire anymore, so that I do not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “They have done well in what they have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will raise up a prophet from among their brothers, like you, and will put My words in his mouth, and he will speak to them all that I command him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be that whoever will not listen to My words which he will speak in My name, I will require it of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the prophet, who presumes to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who shall speak in the name of other gods—that prophet shall die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you may say in your heart, “How can we know the word which the Lord has not spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a prophet speaks in the name of the Lord, if the thing does not occur or come to pass, that is the thing which the Lord has not spoken; the prophet has spoken it presumptuously. You shall not be afraid of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord your God has cut off the nations, whose land the Lord your God is giving you, and you dispossess them, and dwell in their cities, and in their houses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall set apart three cities for yourselves in the midst of your land, which the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall prepare a roadway for yourself, and divide the territory of your land into three parts, which the Lord your God is giving you to inherit, so that every manslayer may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word concerning the manslayer who will flee there, so that he may live: Whoever kills his neighbor unintentionally, whom he did not hate previously,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: like when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut wood, and his hand raises the axe to cut down the tree, and the axe head slips from the handle and lands on his neighbor causing him to die, then he may flee to one of those cities, and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise the avenger of blood might, while he is angry, pursue the manslayer and overtake him (because the way is long) and kill him, even though he was not worthy of death (since he did not hate him previously).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I command you, saying, “You shall set apart three cities for yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Lord your God enlarges your borders as He promised your fathers, and gives you all the land which He promised to give to your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you will carefully keep all these commandments, which I command you today, to love the Lord your God, and to always walk in His ways, then you must add three cities more for yourself, besides these three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then innocent blood will not be shed in your land, which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance, and blood guiltiness be on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any man hates his neighbor, and lies in wait for him, and rises up against him, and mortally strikes him, causing him to die, and flees to one of these cities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the elders of his city must send and fetch him from there, and deliver him to the hand of the avenger of blood, so that he may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your eye must not pity him, but you must remove the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, so that it may go well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not remove your neighbor’s landmark, which they of old time have set in your inheritance, which you shall inherit in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A single witness must not rise up against a man on account of any iniquity or any sin that he sins. At the testimony of two witnesses or at the testimony of three witnesses shall the matter be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a false witness rises up against any man to testify against him to accuse him of doing wrong,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then both the men between whom the controversy is must stand before the Lord, before the priests and the judges, who are in office those days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The judges will thoroughly investigate, and if the witness is a false witness and has testified falsely against his brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must do to him as he conspired to have done to his brother. In this way you must remove the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who remain will hear and fear, and will never again commit any such evil among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not show pity. But life will be for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go out to battle against your enemies, and see horses, and chariots, and a people that outnumber you, do not be afraid of them, for the Lord your God is with you, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be, when you approach the battle, that the priest will approach and speak to the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall say to them, “Hear, O Israel, you approach today to do battle against your enemies. Do not be fainthearted. Do not fear, and do not tremble or be terrified because of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God is He that goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers will speak to the people, saying, “What man is there who has built a new house and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not yet eaten of it? Let him also go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What man is there who is engaged to a woman but has not married her? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man take her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers are to speak further to the people, and they shall say, “What man is there that is fearful and fainthearted? Let him go and return to his house, lest his brother’s heart faint as well as his heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be, when the officers have made an end of speaking to the people, that they must make captains of the armies to lead the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come near to a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, if it gives you a reply of peace and opens to you, then it must be that all the people that are found within shall become slaves to you and they shall serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it will not make peace with you but makes war against you, then you are to besiege it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Lord your God has delivered it into your hands, you are to slay every male there with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the women, and the little ones, and the livestock, and all that is in the city, all the spoil within, you are to take to yourself, and you will eat the spoil of your enemies, which the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you are to do to all the cities which are far away, which are not the cities of these nearby nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But of the cities of these people, which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance, you must not leave alive anything that breathes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall completely destroy them: namely, the Hittites, and the Amorites, the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, just as the Lord your God has commanded you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they do not teach you to participate in all their abominations, which they have done to their gods, causing you to sin against the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you lay siege to a city for a long time, in making war against it in order to take it, you shall not destroy the trees there by chopping them down with an axe, for you may eat from them, and you shall not cut them down. For the tree of the field is not a man in which to lay siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you may destroy and cut down only the trees which you know are not fruit trees, so that you may build siege engines against the city that makes war with you until it falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone is found slain in the land which the Lord your God is giving you to possess, lying in the field, and it is not known who has slain him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then your elders and your judges are to come forth, and they must measure how far it is to the cities which are around him who was slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it must be, that the city which is closest to the slain man, that is, the elders of that city shall take a heifer which has not been worked, that has never pulled in yoke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the elders of that city must bring down the heifer to a valley with flowing water, which is neither plowed nor sown, and shall break the heifer’s neck there in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests, the sons of Levi, must come near, for the Lord your God has chosen them to minister to Him, and to bless in the name of the Lord, and by their word every controversy and every assault will be settled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the elders of that city, which is nearest to the slain man, shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they must answer and say, “Our hands have not shed this blood, and our eyes have not seen it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful, O Lord, to Your people Israel, whom You have redeemed, and lay not innocent blood in the midst of Your people Israel.” And the blood guilt will be forgiven them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way you are to remove the guilt of innocent blood from among you when you do that which is right in the eyes of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go forth to war against your enemies, and the Lord your God has delivered them into your hands, and you have taken them captive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you see among the captives a beautiful woman, and have a desire for her to have her as your wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you are to bring her home to your house, and she is to shave her head and trim her nails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She must also discard the clothing of her captivity and shall remain in your house, and mourn her father and her mother for a full month. After that you may have relations with her, and be her husband, and she will be your wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be, if you are not pleased with her, then you must let her go wherever she pleases, but you may not sell her at all for money, nor are you to make merchandise of her, because you have humbled her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man has two wives, one beloved and another unloved, and both have borne him children, both the loved one and the unloved one, and if the firstborn son is hers that is unloved,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it must be, when he gives his sons the inheritance which he has, that he may not make the firstborn son of the loved come before the son of the unloved, who was indeed the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, he must acknowledge the son of the unloved for the firstborn, by giving him a double portion of all that he has, for he is the beginning of his strength. The right of the firstborn is his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son, who will not obey the voice of his father or the voice of his mother, and who, when they have disciplined him, will not listen to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his father and his mother are to lay hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his city, to the gate of his city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall say to the elders of his city, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious. He will not listen to us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the men of his city must stone him with stones, until he dies. In this way you are to remove the evil from among you, and all Israel shall hear and fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death and is executed, and you hang him on a tree,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his body must not remain all night on the tree, but you must bury him that day (for he that is hanged is accursed of God) so that your land may not be defiled, which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not see your brother’s ox or his sheep go astray and hide yourself from them. You must certainly bring them back to your brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your brother is not near you or if you do not know him, then you are to bring it to your own house, and it will be with you until your brother seeks after it. Then you must return it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, you must do so with his donkey, with his clothing, and with anything lost by your brother which he has lost and you have found. You must not hide yourself from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to see your brother’s donkey or his ox fall down by the way and hide yourself from them. You certainly must help him to lift them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman must not wear man’s clothing, nor is a man to put on a woman’s clothing. For all that do so are abominations to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you happen to notice a bird’s nest along the way, in any tree or on the ground, whether they be young ones or eggs, and the mother is sitting on the young or on the eggs, you are not to take the mother from the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must certainly let the mother go, but you may take the young for yourself, so that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you build a new house, you must make a guard rail for your roof so that you bring no blood guilt on your house, should anyone fall from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not sow your vineyard with two kinds of seeds, or the fruit of your seed which you have sown and the fruit of your vineyard will be defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not plow with an ox and a donkey together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not wear clothing made of a material of wool and linen together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must make tassels on the four quarters of your clothing with which you cover yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man takes a wife and has sexual relations with her and then rejects her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and accuses her of impropriety and publicly defames her, saying, “I married this woman, but when I had sexual relations with her, I found her not to be a virgin,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the father and mother of the girl must produce evidence of the girl’s virginity to the elders of the city at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl’s father must say to the elders, “I gave my daughter to this man to wife, and he has rejected her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What is more, he has accused her of impropriety, saying, ‘I did not find your daughter to be a virgin.’ However, this is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity.” And they shall spread the cloth before the elders of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of that city must take that man and punish him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they must fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give them to the father of the girl, because he has publicly humiliated a virgin of Israel. Then she is to remain his wife. He may not divorce her all his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the accusation is true, and the evidence of virginity does not exist for the girl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then they shall bring the girl out to the door of her father’s house, and the men of her city shall stone her with stones until she dies, because she has brought disgrace into Israel, to act like a whore in her father’s house. In this way you may purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man is discovered lying with a married woman, then both of them must die, both the man that lay with the woman, and the woman. In this way you may purge the evil from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a girl who is a virgin is engaged to a man, and another man finds her in the city and has sexual relations with her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must bring them both out to the gate of that city and you must stone them with stones until they die, the girl because she did not cry out even though in the city, and the man because he has violated his neighbor’s wife. In this way you may purge the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a man finds an engaged girl in the field, and the man forces her and rapes her, then only the man that raped her shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, you are to do nothing to the girl. There is no sin worthy of death in the girl, for just as when a man rises against his neighbor and murders him, so is this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he found her in the field, the engaged girl cried out, but there was no one to save her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man finds a girl who is a virgin who is not engaged and seizes her and lies with her and they are discovered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the man who lay with her must give fifty shekels of silver to the girl’s father, and she shall be his wife because he has violated her. He may not divorce her all his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man must not marry his father’s wife and in this way dishonor his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one who is emasculated or has his male organ cut off may enter the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one of illegitimate birth may enter the assembly of the Lord. Even to his tenth generation no one related to him may enter the assembly of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No Ammonite or Moabite may enter the assembly of the Lord. Even to their tenth generation they may not enter the assembly of the Lord forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they refused you bread and water on the way, when you came from out of Egypt and because they hired Balaam, the son of Beor of Pethor of Mesopotamia, against you to curse you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the Lord your God would not listen to Balaam. Instead the Lord your God turned the curse into a blessing on you because the Lord your God loves you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not ever to seek their peace nor their prosperity all your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are not to abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, because you were a foreigner in his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children who are born of them may enter the assembly of the Lord in their third generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the army goes out against your enemies, then keep yourself from every wicked thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there be among you any man who is not clean because of a nocturnal emission, then he must leave the camp. He may not re-enter the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it must be that when evening comes, he must wash himself with water, and at sunset he may re-enter the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also have a place outside the camp where one may go outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must have a spade among your equipment, and it must be, when you relieve yourself outside, you must dig there and turn and cover up your excrement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp, to deliver you, and to defeat your enemies before you. Therefore, your camp must be holy, so that He does not see any indecent thing among you, and turn away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not deliver back to his master a slave who has escaped from his master to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is to dwell with you, even among you, in a place which he shall choose in one of your towns, where he prefers. You must not oppress him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There must never be a cult prostitute among the daughters of Israel nor a cult prostitute among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must never bring the wage of a prostitute or the wage of a dog into the house of the Lord your God for any vow, for both of these are abominations to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not charge interest on a loan to your brother: interest on money, interest on food, or on anything that may be lent with interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may charge interest to a foreigner, but to your brother you may not lend with interest so that the Lord your God may bless you in all to which you set your hand in the land which you are entering to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you make a vow to the Lord your God, you must not be slow to pay it, for the Lord your God will surely require it of you, and it would be a sin to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you refrain from making a vow, it will not be a sin to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which goes out of your lips you must keep and do, even a freewill offering, just as you have vowed to the Lord your God, what you have promised with your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go into your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat grapes to your fill at your own pleasure, but you may not put any in your basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you enter into the standing grain of your neighbor, you may pluck the ears with your hand, but you may not use a sickle on your neighbor’s standing grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man takes a wife and marries her, and it happens that she finds no favor in his eyes because he has found some indecency in her, then let him write her a bill of divorce and put it in her hand and send her out of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she departs out of his house, she may go and be another man’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the second husband rejects her and writes her a bill of divorce and puts it in her hand and sends her out of his house, or if the second husband who took her to be his wife dies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: her first husband, who sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, since she is defiled, for that is abomination before the Lord, and you must not bring sin on the land, which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man has taken a new wife, he shall not go out to war or be charged with any business; he is to be free at home one year, and must bring joy to his wife which he has taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man shall take a lower or upper millstone as a pledge, for he would be taking a man’s life as a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man is found kidnapping any of his brothers of the children of Israel, and makes property of him or sells him, then that kidnapper must die, and you must remove the evil from among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful with an outbreak of leprosy, that you diligently observe and do according to all that the Levitical priests instruct you. As I have commanded them, so you must carefully do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam on the way, after you came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you do lend your brother anything, you may not go into his house to take his pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must stand outside, and the man to whom you lend must bring the pledge outside to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man is poor, you may not sleep with his pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In any case, you must return the pledge to him when the sun goes down, so that he may sleep in his own cloak and bless you, and it will be righteousness to you before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not oppress a hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he is one of your brothers or one of your foreigners who are in your land within your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must give him his wages on that very day before the sun sets, for he is poor, and sets his heart on it, lest he cry against you to the Lord, and it be a sin to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers may not be put to death for the sons, nor shall sons be put to death for their fathers. Every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not pervert the justice of the foreigner or of the fatherless, nor take a widow’s cloak as a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the contrary, you must remember that you were a slave in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you there. Therefore, I command you to do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you reap your harvest in your field and have forgotten a sheaf in the field, you may not go back to get it. It will be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you beat your olive tree, you may not go over the boughs again. It will be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you shall not glean it again. It will be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt. Therefore I command you to do this thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is a controversy between men, they are to go to court for judgment, so that the judges may judge them. Then they shall justify the righteous and condemn the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be, if the wicked man is worthy to be beaten, then the judge must make him lie down and be beaten in his presence, with the number of strikes his guilt deserves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may give him forty stripes, but no more, lest, if he should exceed and beat him more with numerous stripes, then your brother may appear contemptible to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not muzzle the ox when he treads out the grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If brothers dwell together, and one of them dies without having had a child, the wife of the deceased may not marry outside the family to a stranger. Her husband’s brother must go to her and take her to himself as a wife and perform the duty of a husband’s brother to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be, that the firstborn whom she bears shall continue in the name of his brother who is deceased, so that his name will not be blotted out of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man does not want to take his brother’s wife, then let his brother’s wife go up to the gate to the elders and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to raise up his brother’s name in Israel. He will not perform the duty of my husband’s brother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak to him, and if he persists and says, “I do not want to take her,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his brother’s wife must come to him in the presence of the elders and remove his sandal from his foot, and spit in his face, and answer and say, “So shall it be done to that man who will not build up his brother’s house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His name will be called in Israel, “The house of him who has his sandal removed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man and his brother fight one another, and the wife of the one draws near in order to deliver her husband out of the hand of him who fights him, and reaches out her hand and seizes him by the private parts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must cut off her hand. You must not pity her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not have in your bag different weights, a large and a small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not have in your house differing measures, a large and a small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must have a perfect and just weight—a perfect and just measure you must have, so that your days may be lengthened in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all who do such things and all who act unjustly are an abomination to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what Amalek did to you by the road when you were coming out of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how he met you by the way and attacked at your rear all that were stragglers behind you, when you were exhausted and weary. He did not fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it shall be, when the Lord your God has given you rest from all your surrounding enemies, in the land which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance to possess, that you must blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven. You must not forget it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it must be, when you come into the land which the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance, and you possess it, and dwell in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you shall take from the first of all the produce of the ground which you shall bring from your land that the Lord your God is giving you, and put it in a basket and go to the place where the Lord your God chooses to make His name abide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall go to the priest in office at that time and say to him, “I profess this day to the Lord your God that I have come into the land which the Lord promised to our fathers to give us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take the basket out of your hand and set it down before the altar of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must answer and say before the Lord your God, “A wandering Aramean was my father, and he went down into Egypt, and sojourned there with only a few in number, but there he became a great, mighty, and populous nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the Egyptians mistreated and afflicted us, and laid upon us harsh labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we cried to the Lord God of our fathers, the Lord heard our voice, and looked on our affliction, our labor, and our oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord brought us forth out of Egypt with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm and with great terror, and with signs and wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He brought us into this place, and has given us this land, a land that flows with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, indeed, I have brought the first fruits of the land, which you, O Lord, have given me.” Then you must set it before the Lord your God and worship before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must rejoice in every good thing which the Lord your God has given to you and your house, you, and the Levite, as well as the foreigner who is among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have finished tithing all the tithes of your income the third year, which is the year of tithing, and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow, that they may eat within your towns and be satisfied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say before the Lord your God, “I have removed the sacred things out of my house and also have given them to the Levite, and to the foreigner, to the orphan, and to the widow, according to all Your commandments which You have commanded me. I have not transgressed Your commandments or forgotten them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not eaten anything when in mourning, nor have I removed anything while unclean, nor offered anything to the dead. I have listened to the voice of the Lord my God and have done according to all that You have commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look down from Your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the land which You have given us, as You swore to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today the Lord your God has commanded you to do these statutes and judgments. You must therefore keep and do them with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have affirmed today that the Lord is your God and vowed to walk in His ways, and to keep His statutes, and His commandments, and His judgments, and to listen to His voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord has affirmed today that you are His special people, just as He has promised you, and that you should keep all His commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will exalt you above all nations which He has made, in praise, and in name, and in honor; and that you may be a holy people to the Lord your God, just as He has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying: Keep all the commandments which I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day when you cross over the Jordan into the land which the Lord your God is giving you, you must set up for yourself great stones, and cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must write all the words of this law on them, when you cross over, so that you may enter into the land which the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the Lord God of your fathers promised you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when you cross over the Jordan, you shall set up these stones, which I am commanding you today, on Mount Ebal, and you shall cover them with plaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There you must build an altar to the Lord your God, an altar of stones. You must not use any iron tool on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must build the altar of the Lord your God with whole stones, and you must offer burnt offerings on it to the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must offer peace offerings and eat there, and rejoice before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must write all the words of this law very clearly on the stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying: Be silent and listen, O Israel. Today you have become the people of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you must obey the voice of the Lord your God and do His commandments and His statutes, which I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the people the same day, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people when you cross over the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these must stand on Mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites will answer and say to all the men of Israel with a loud voice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is the man who makes any graven or molded image, an abomination to the Lord, the work of the hands of the craftsman, and puts it in a secret place.” And all the people shall answer and say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who disrespects his father or his mother.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who removes his neighbor’s landmark.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who misleads the blind man on the road.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who perverts justice for the foreigner, orphan, and widow.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who lies with his father’s wife, for he dishonors his father.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who lies with any kind of beast.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who lies with his sister, the daughter of his father, or the daughter of his mother.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who lies with his mother-in-law.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who strikes down his neighbor secretly.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who receives pay to slay an innocent person.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Cursed is he who does not confirm all the words of this law by doing them.” And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it will be, if you will diligently obey the voice of the Lord your God, being careful to do all His commandments which I am commanding you today, then the Lord your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all these blessings will come on you and overtake you if you listen to the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your offspring will be blessed, and the produce of your ground, and the offspring of your livestock, the increase of your herd and the flocks of your sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your basket and your kneading bowl will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will cause your enemies who rise up against you to be defeated before you; they will come out against you one way and flee before you seven ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will command the blessing on you in your barns and in all that you set your hand to do, and He will bless you in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will establish you as a holy people to Himself, just as He swore to you, if you will keep the commandments of the Lord your God and walk in His ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All people of the earth shall see that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they shall be afraid of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make you overflow in prosperity, in the offspring of your body, in the offspring of your livestock, and in the produce of your ground, in the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will open up to you His good treasure, the heavens, to give the rain to your land in its season and to bless all the work of your hand. You will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make you the head and not the tail; you will only be above and you will not be beneath, if you listen to the commandments of the Lord your God, which I am commanding you today, to observe and to do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, you shall not turn aside from any of the words which I am commanding you today, to the right hand or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it will happen, if you will not listen to the voice of the Lord your God, by being careful to do all His commandments and His statutes which I am commanding you today, that all these curses will come upon you and overtake you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your basket and your kneading bowl will be cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your offspring will be cursed along with the fruit of your land, the produce of your herd, and the flocks of your sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will send cursing, vexation, and rebuke on you in all that you set your hand to do, until you are destroyed and until you perish quickly because of the wickedness of your doings, by which you have forsaken Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make pestilence cling to you until it has consumed you from the land, which you are going to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you with a wasting disease, with a fever, with an inflammation, with an extreme heat, with the sword, with blight, and with mildew, and they shall pursue you until you perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heavens which are over your head will be bronze, and the earth that is under you will be iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will make the rain of your land powder and dust. It will come from heaven down on you until you are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will cause you to be defeated before your enemies, and you will go out one way against them and flee seven ways before them, and will be become an object of terror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your carcass will be meat for all the fowls of the air and beasts of the earth, and no man will frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors, eczema, and with the itch, from which you cannot be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you with madness, and blindness, and bewilderment of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will grope at noon, as the blind man gropes in darkness, and you will not prosper in your ways. You will only be oppressed and continually robbed, and no man will save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be engaged to a woman and another man shall rape her. You will build a house, but you will not dwell in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you will not gather its grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ox will be killed before your eyes, and you will not eat of it. Your donkey will be violently taken away from before you and will not be returned to you. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and you will have no one to rescue them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people. Your eyes will look and fail with longing for them all day long, but there will be nothing you can do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A nation that you do not know will consume the produce of your land and all your labors, and you will be nothing but oppressed and crushed all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will go insane because of what your eyes will see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will strike you in the knees and legs with sore boils that cannot be healed, from the sole of your foot to the top of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring you and your king, which you will set over you, to a nation which neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will serve other gods, wood and stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will become a horror, a proverb, and an object of ridicule among all nations where the Lord shall lead you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will carry a lot of seed out into the field but will gather but little in, for the locust will consume it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will plant vineyards and dress them, but will neither drink of the wine nor gather the grapes, for worms will eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will have olive trees throughout all your coasts, but you will not anoint yourself with the oil, for your olive will drop off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will give birth to sons and daughters, but you will not enjoy them, for they will go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The locust will consume all of your trees and fruit of your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foreigner who resides with you will get up higher and higher, and you will go down lower and lower.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will lend to you, but you will not lend to him. He will be the head, but you will be the tail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, all of these curses will come on you and will pursue you and overtake you, until you are destroyed, because you did not obey the voice of the Lord your God, by keeping His commandments and His statutes which He commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be a perpetual sign and wonder in regard to you and your descendants,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you did not serve the Lord your God with joy and with gladness of heart, for the abundance of all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you will serve your enemies whom the Lord will send against you, in hunger, thirst, nakedness, and need of all things, and He will put a yoke of iron on your neck until He has destroyed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring a nation against you from far away, from the end of the earth, as swift as the eagle flies, a nation whose language you will not understand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a nation with a fierce countenance, which will not respect the old or show favor to the young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will eat the offspring of your livestock and the produce of your land, until you are destroyed. They will leave you no grain, wine, or oil, or the offspring of your herd or the offspring of your sheep, until they have destroyed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will lay siege on you in all your towns until your high and fortified walls in which you trusted come down throughout all your land, and he will lay siege on you in all your towns throughout all your land which the Lord your God has given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat the offspring of your own body, the flesh of your sons and of your daughters, which the Lord your God has given you, during the siege and distress in which your enemies will persecute you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who is tender among you, and very delicate, his eye shall be hostile toward his brother and toward his beloved wife and toward the rest of his children who remain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he will not give to any of them any of the flesh of his children which he will eat, because he has nothing left to him because of the siege and the distress by which your enemies will persecute you in all your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground because of her delicateness and tenderness, will be hostile toward her beloved husband, and toward her son and her daughter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and toward her afterbirth that comes out from between her legs, and toward her children whom she will bear. For she will secretly eat them because of lack during the siege and distress in which your enemy will persecute you in your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are not careful to observe all the words of this law that are written in this book so that you may fear this glorious and fearful name, the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord will bring extraordinary plagues on you and your descendants, even great long-lasting plagues, and severe and long-lasting sicknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, He will bring all the diseases of Egypt upon you, which you were afraid of, and they will cling to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also every sickness and every plague which is not written in the Book of the Law will the Lord bring upon you until you are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be left few in number, whereas you were as numerous as the stars of heaven, because you would not obey the voice of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be that as the Lord rejoiced over you to do you good and to multiply you, so the Lord will take pleasure over you to destroy you and to bring you to nothing. You will be plucked from off the land which you go to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will scatter you among all the peoples, from the one end of the earth to the other, and there you will serve other gods, wood and stone, which neither you nor your fathers have known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among these nations you will find no ease, nor will the sole of your foot have rest. But there the Lord will give you a trembling heart, failing of eyes, and despair of soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your life shall hang in doubt before you. You will be in dread day and night and will have no assurance of your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning you will say, “Would to God it were evening!” And at evening you will say, “Would to God it were morning!” because of the fear of your heart and because of the sights your eyes will see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will bring you into Egypt again with ships, by the way by which I spoke to you, “You will not see it ever again.” And there you will be sold to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words of the covenant which the Lord commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which He made with them in Horeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses proclaimed to all Israel, and said to them:
You have seen all that the Lord did before your eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and all his servants and to all his land—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the great temptations which your eyes have seen, those signs and great wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet to this day the Lord has not given you a heart to know, eyes to see, and ears to hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have led you forty years in the wilderness. Your clothes have not worn out on you, and your sandal has not worn out on your foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not eaten bread, nor have you drunk wine or strong drink, so that you might know that I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you came to this place, Sihon, the king of Heshbon, and Og, the king of Bashan, came out against us to battle, and we defeated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and to half of the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, keep the words of this covenant and do them, so that you may prosper in all you do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today all of you stand before the Lord your God, the heads of your tribes, your elders, and your officers, with all the men of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: your little ones, your wives, and your foreigners who are in your camp, from the one who chops your wood to the one who draws your water—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you should enter into a covenant with the Lord your God, and into His oath, which the Lord your God is making with you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today He will establish that you are His people and that He is your God, just as He has said to you and He has sworn to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not with you alone that I am making this covenant and this oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with him who stands here with us today before the Lord our God, and with him who is not here with us today
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for you know that we lived in the land of Egypt and how we came through the nations which you passed by,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you have seen their abominations and their idols of wood and stone, of silver and gold, which were among them);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest there be among you a man or woman or family or tribe whose heart turns away today from the Lord our God to go and serve the gods of these nations, and lest there be among you a root bearing poisonous and bitter fruit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and it happens that, when he hears the words of this covenant, he blesses himself in his heart, saying, “I shall have peace, even though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart,” thus destroying the watered ground with the dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will not spare him; rather the anger of the Lord and His jealousy will smolder against that man. All the curses that are written in this book will rest on him, and the Lord will blot out his name from under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will single him out for disaster out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that are written in this Book of the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The generation to come, your children who will rise up after you and the foreigner who will come from a far land, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses which the Lord has laid on it, will say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The whole land is brimstone and salt, a burning waste, unsown and unproductive, and no grass grows there, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, which the Lord overthrew in His anger and wrath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All nations will say, “Why has the Lord done such to this land? What does the heatedness of this great anger mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then men will say, “Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they went and served other gods, and worshipped them, gods which they did not know and which He had not given to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The anger of the Lord burned against this land, bringing on it all the curses that are written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord rooted them out of their land in anger and in wrath and in great indignation, and threw them into another land, as it is today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but those things which are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, so that we may keep all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all these things happen to you, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before you, and you remember them among all the nations, where the Lord your God has driven you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you must return to the Lord your God and obey His voice according to all that I am commanding you today, you and your children, with all your heart, and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord your God will overturn your captivity and have compassion on you and will return and gather you from all the nations, where the Lord your God has scattered you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of you are driven out to the outmost parts of heaven, from there will the Lord your God gather you, and from there He will get you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will bring you to the land which your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it. He will prosper you and multiply you more than your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will circumcise your heart and the heart of your descendants to love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul, so that you may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will put all these curses on your enemies, on them who hate you, who persecuted you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will return and obey the voice of the Lord, and obey all His commandments which I am commanding you today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will make you prosper in every work of your hand, in the offspring of your body, and in the offspring of your livestock, and in the produce of your land, for good. For the Lord will once again rejoice over you for good, just as He rejoiced over your fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you obey the voice of the Lord your God, by keeping His commandments and His statutes which are written in this Book of the Law, and if you return to the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This commandment which I am commanding you today is not hidden from you, nor is it far off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not in heaven, that you should say, “Who will go up for us to heaven and bring it to us, so that we may hear it and do it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not beyond the sea, so that you should say, “Who shall go over the sea for us and bring it to us, so that we may hear it and do it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word is very near to you, in your mouth, and in your heart, so that you may do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, today I have set before you life and prosperity, and death and disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I am commanding you today is to love the Lord your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments and His statutes and His judgments, so that you may live and multiply. Then the Lord your God will bless you in the land which you go to possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if your heart turns away, so that you do not obey, but are drawn away, and worship other gods and serve them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I declare to you today that you will surely perish and that you will not prolong your days in the land which you are crossing the Jordan to go in and possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call heaven and earth to witnesses against you this day, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life, that both you and your descendants may live;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may love the Lord your God, that you may obey His voice, and that you may cling to Him, for He is your life and the length of your days; and that you may dwell in the land that the Lord swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “I am a hundred and twenty years old today. I can no longer come and go. Also, the Lord has said to me, ‘You may not cross over the Jordan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord your God will cross over before you. He will destroy these nations before you, you will possess them, and Joshua will cross over before you, just as the Lord has said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will do to them as He did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land, which He destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will give them up before you, so that you may do to them according to all the commandments which I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong and of a good courage. Fear not, nor be afraid of them, for the Lord your God, it is He who goes with you. He will not fail you, nor forsake you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses called to Joshua, and said to him in the sight of all Israel, “Be strong and of good courage, for you must go with this people to the land which the Lord has sworn to their fathers to give them, and you will enable them to inherit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord, He goes before you. He will be with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you. Do not fear, nor be dismayed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote this law and delivered it to the priests, the sons of Levi who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded them, saying, “At the end of every seven years, at the time of the year of the cancellation of debts, at the Feast of Tabernacles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when all Israel has come to appear before the Lord your God in the place which He will choose, you must read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gather the people together, men, women, children, and your foreigner who is within your towns, so that they may hear and learn and fear the Lord your God, and observe to do all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their children, who have not known it, may hear and learn to fear the Lord your God, as long as you live in the land which you cross the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Indeed, your days draw near when you must die. Call Joshua, and present yourselves in the tent of meeting, so that I may commission him.” So Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator
