verses.text: The Lord appeared in the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the pillar of cloud stood over the door of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “You are about to lie down with your fathers, and this people will rise up and begin to prostitute themselves after the gods of the foreigners of the land, where they are going to be among them, and will forsake Me and break My covenant which I have made with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then My anger will burn against them on that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide My face from them, and they will be devoured, and many disasters and troubles will befall them, so that they will say in that day, ‘Have not these disasters come upon us because our God is not among us?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will surely hide My face in that day for all the evil things which they shall have done, in that they turned to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore write yourself this song and teach it to the children of Israel. Put it on their mouths, so that this song may be a witness for Me against the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I have brought them into the land which I swore to their fathers, flowing with milk and honey, and they have eaten, and filled themselves, and become fat, then they will turn to other gods, and serve them, and provoke Me, and break My covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when many disasters and troubles have fallen on them, this song will testify against them as a witness, for it must not be forgotten from the mouths of their descendants. For I know their intention which they are developing even now, before I have brought them into the land which I promised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, Moses wrote this song the same day, and taught it to the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave Joshua, the son of Nun, an exhortation, and said, “Be strong and of a good courage, for you will bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them, and I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses had finished writing the words of this law in a book, until they were completed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Moses commanded the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take this Book of the Law, and put it inside the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, so that it may be there for a witness against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know your rebellion and your stiff neck. Even now, while I am yet alive with you today, you have been rebellious against the Lord. How much more after my death?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gather to me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, so that I may speak these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know that after my death you will utterly corrupt yourselves and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you, and disaster will befall you in the latter days, because you will do evil in the sight of the Lord, to provoke Him to anger through the work of your hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke the words of this song until they were finished, in the hearing of all the assembly of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak;
    hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My teaching will drop like the rain,
    my sayings will distill as the dew,
as the droplets on the grass,
    and as the showers on the herb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will proclaim the name of the Lord:
    Ascribe greatness to our God!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Is this how you repay the Lord,
    you foolish and unwise people?
Is He not your father, who has bought you?
    Has He not made you, and established you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the days of old,
    consider the years of previous generations.
Ask your father, and he will show you;
    your elders, and they will tell you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance,
    when He separated the sons of man,
He set the boundaries of the peoples
    according to the number of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord’s portion is His people;
    Jacob is the allotment of His inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He found him in a desert land
    and in the howling waste of a wilderness;
He led him about, He instructed him,
    He protected him like the pupil of His eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord alone guided him,
    and there was no foreign god with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him ride on the high places of the earth,
    and he ate of the produce of the fields;
He made him suck honey out of the rock
    and oil out of the flinty rock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
butter from the herd,
    and milk from the flock,
    along with the fat of lambs,
and rams of the breed from Bashan,
    and goats,
    with the best of the kernels of wheat;
you drank the pure blood of the grape.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They made Him jealous with strange gods;
    with abominations they provoked Him to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrificed to demons, not to God,
    to gods whom they knew not,
    to new gods that recently came along,
    whom your fathers did not fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have forgotten the Rock who begot you;
    you are unmindful, and have forgotten the God who gave you birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord saw it, He despised them,
    because of the provocation of His sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For a fire has been inflamed by My anger,
    and it will burn to the lowest part of Sheol,
and shall consume the earth and its produce,
    and ignite the foundations of the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will heap misfortunes on them;
    I will use My arrows on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be starved by famine,
    and consumed by plague and bitter destruction;
I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them,
    with the poison of crawling creatures in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sword outside and terror within will destroy both the young man and the virgin,
    the infant along with the man of gray hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “I want to cut them into pieces,
    I will cause the memory of them to disappear from among men,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
however, I feared the wrath of the enemy,
    that their adversaries would misunderstand
and say, “Our hand is victorious,
    and the Lord has not done all this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they are a nation devoid of counsel;
    there is no understanding in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Would that they were wise,
    so that they understood this,
    so that they would comprehend their future!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How should one chase a thousand,
    and two put ten thousand to flight,
unless their Rock had sold them,
    and the Lord had given them up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their rock is not as our Rock;
    even our enemies themselves concede this.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their wine is the poison of dragons
    and the deadly venom of cobras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not this laid up in store with Me
    and sealed up among My treasures?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will judge His people,
    and relent in regard to His servants,
when He sees that their power is gone
    and there is no one left, whether restrained or free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will say: Where are their gods,
    their rock in whom they trusted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which ate the fat of their sacrifices
    and drank the wine of their drink offerings?
Let them rise up and help you
    and be your protection.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I lift up My hand to heaven,
    and say: As I live forever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I sharpen My flashing sword
    and My hand takes hold on judgment,
I will render vengeance on My enemies
    and will repay those who hate Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make My arrows drunk with blood,
    and My sword shall devour flesh,
with the blood of the slain and of the captives,
    from the heads of the leaders of the enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice, O you nations, with His people;
    for He will avenge the blood of His servants
and will render vengeance on His adversaries
    and will be merciful to His land and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he, with Joshua, the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said to them, “Set your hearts on all the words which I testify among you today, which you shall command your children to be careful to observe, all the words of this law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is no idle word for you, because it is your life, and by this word you will prolong your days in the land which you cross over the Jordan to possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses that same day, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go up to this mountain of the Abarim, to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab opposite Jericho, and look at the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel for a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Die on the mount where you go up, and be gathered to your people, just as Aaron, your brother, died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you trespassed against Me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the Wilderness of Zin, because you did not treat Me as holy in the midst of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, you will see the land before you, but you may not go there, to the land which I am giving to the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the children of Israel before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moses decreed to us a law,
    the inheritance of the assembly of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was king over Jeshurun,
    when the heads of the people and the tribes of Israel were gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let Reuben live, and not die,
    and let not his men be few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the blessing to Judah. He said:
Listen, O Lord, to the voice of Judah,
    and bring him to his people;
may his hands contend for them,
    and may You help him against his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Levi he said:
Let Your Thummim and Your Urim be with Your godly one,
whom You tested at Massah,
    and with whom You contended at the waters of Meribah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who said to his father and to his mother,
    “I have not seen him,”
and he did not acknowledge his brothers
    or know his own children,
for they have kept Your word
    and guarded Your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will teach Jacob Your judgments
    and Israel Your law.
They will put incense before You
    and the whole burnt offerings on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless, O Lord, his substance,
    and accept the work of his hands;
run through the loins of them that rise against him
    and of them that hate him,
    so that they rise never again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Benjamin he said:
The beloved of the Lord
    will dwell in safety by Him,
and the Lord will protect him all day long;
    he will dwell between His shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Joseph he said:
May his land be blessed of the Lord,
    from the harvest of the heavens,
    by the dew,
    and by the deep crouching beneath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by the precious fruits brought forth by the sun,
    and by the choice things put forth by the moon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by the finest things of the ancient mountains,
    and by the choice things of the everlasting hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by the best things of the earth and its fullness,
    and by the goodwill of Him who dwelt in the bush.
May the blessing rest on the head of Joseph,
    on top of the head of him who was separated from his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Of Zebulun he said:
Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going outside,
    and Issachar in your tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will call the peoples to the mountain;
    there they will offer sacrifices of righteousness,
for they will draw out the abundance of the seas
    and the treasures hid in the sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Gad he said:
Blessed be he who enlarges Gad;
    he dwells as a lion
    and tears an arm and the crown of a head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He provided the first part for himself,
    because there, in a portion of the ruler, he was seated.
He came with the heads of the people.
    He executed the justice of the Lord,
    and His ordinances with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Of Naphtali he said:
O Naphtali, satisfied with favor
    and full with the blessing of the Lord,
    possess the west and the south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Asher he said:
May Asher be blessed with children;
    may he be acceptable to his brothers,
    and may he dip his foot in oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sandals will be iron and brass;
    according to your days, so shall be your strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is none like the God of Jeshurun,
    who rides through the heavens to help you,
    and in His majesty through the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eternal God is your refuge,
    and underneath you are the everlasting arms;
He will drive out the enemy before you,
    and will say, “Destroy them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you, O Israel!
    Who is like you,
    a people saved by the Lord,
the shield of your help,
    who is the sword of your majesty!
Your enemies will cringe before you,
    and you will tread upon their high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. Then the Lord showed him all the land—from Gilead to Dan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, to the Mediterranean Sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Negev and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, as far as Zoar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “This is the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have caused you to see it with your eyes, but you will not cross over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses, the servant of the Lord, died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, opposite Beth Peor, but no man knows of his burial place to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died. His eye was not dim, nor was his vitality diminished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days. Then the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Joshua, the son of Nun, was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands on him. And the children of Israel listened to him and did as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since then there has not arisen a prophet in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord knew face to face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in all the signs and wonders which the Lord sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, to all his servants, and to all his land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and by all that mighty power and by all the great terror which Moses displayed in the sight of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
